intro: Ambaiba leucophaea, commonly known as the white-leafed ambabia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically white or pale green in color. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Ambaiba leucophaea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
